meanings.def: the movement every year of large numbers of birds or animals from one place to another
examples: the seasonal migration of blue whales

meanings.def: the movement of people to a new country or area in order to find work or better living conditions
examples: migration from rural to urban areas
It was one of the largest mass migrations in US history.
Net migration— more people moving to the state than leaving—accounts for about two thirds of the population gain.
The decline of the rural economy has caused urban migration.
the forced migration of enslaved Africans
the great waves of migration that took Europeans to the New World

meanings.def: the act of moving programs, etc. from one computer system to another; the fact of changing from one computer system to another
